alert.note: Alert for Aguila Valley; Tonopah Desert (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 5:17PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa County through 600 PM MST... At 517 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles southeast of Aguila, or 15 miles southwest of Wickenburg, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of Maricopa County. This includes US Highway 60 between mile markers 93 and 97. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
